content.question: Which of the following conclusions regarding voter turnout in this election is represented by the data in the table?

choices.label: Most eligible Russians did not vote, thus undermining the sovereignty of Putinâ€™s regime.
Turnout was achieved mostly by election rigging and ballot fraud because Putin is not very popular.
Turnout for Zhirinovsky would have been higher if his party was not so radically pro-democracy.
A majority of those eligible to vote cast ballots for Putin, thus strengthening his hold on the Russian government.

content.answer: A majority of those eligible to vote cast ballots for Putin, thus strengthening his hold on the Russian government.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
